result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L. Kass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy L. Kass is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy L. Kass was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Jeremy L. Kass was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence serving and concurrent with 14CF402

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution of $507.32 and restitution surcharge of $50.73.

No contact with Kwik Trip West, Tomah; Ace Hardware; All American Do It Center; O'Reilly Auto Parts Store; Casey's General Store; Tomah Cash Store; Car Quest; Goodwill and Sparta Travel Center.

No contact with N.T. or her residence unless approved by agent.

No contact with J.W. or his residence unless approved by agent.

Defendant shall not write, issue or possess checks.

Defendant to participate in and complete CGIP or another appropriate criminal thinking classes.

Defendant to undergo a psychiatric evaluation and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Comply with any conditions, assessments and treatment per agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
